channel.title: Frontend Deploy :: Internship Report
channel.description: Architectural model Domain: Route 53 (DNS) + ACM (SSL Certificate). CDN: CloudFront (Global Edge Network). Storage (Primary): S3 Singapore (ap-southeast-1). Storage (Failover): S3 N. Virginia (us-east-1). Replication: Automatically copy code from Singapore -> Virginia. Security: OAC (Origin Access Control) - Private Bucket. Table of Contents Prerequisites

item.title: Prerequisites
item.description: Preparation Requirements A registered domain name (e.g. sgutodolist.com) With AWS Free Tier accounts, Route 53 domain registration is not supported. Therefore, in this project, the domain is registered with a third-party domain provider and then hosted on Amazon Route 53. An AWS account A successfully built ReactJS project AWS CLI (optional, for testing and validation)

item.title: S3 and Replication
item.description: PHASE 1: STORAGE PREPARATION (S3 & REPLICATION) This phase focuses on creating a durable storage layer for frontend resources and setting up an automated cross-region synchronization mechanism. Step 1.1: Create the Primary Bucket (Singapore) Open the Amazon S3 Console and select the Asia Pacific (Singapore) region.

item.title: Route 53 and ACM
item.description: PHASE 2: DOMAIN & SECURITY PREPARATION (ROUTE 53 & ACM) Before creating the CloudFront distribution, the domain name system (DNS) and SSL certificates must be properly prepared. Step 2.1: Create a Hosted Zone (If Not Exists) Navigate to Amazon Route 53 → Hosted zones.

item.title: ClouFront and Failover
item.description: STAGE 3: CONFIGURATION CLOUDFRONT (CDN & FAILOVER) STEP 3.1: Create Distribution Step 1: Get started Distribution name: sgutodolist-frontend-cloudfront Distribution type: Keep Single website or app.

item.title: S3 Policy
item.description: STAGE 4: S3 PERMITS (POLICY) CloudFront needs a “permission” to pull files from your 2 closed buckets. In CloudFront > Origins tab. Select Origin Singapore > Edit > Copy policy. Open a new tab > S3 Console > Bucket sgutodolist-frontend-sg. Permissions tab > Bucket Policy > Edit > Paste > Save. Repeat with Bucket Virginia:

item.title: DNS Record
item.description: PHASE 5: POINT OFFICIAL DOMAIN (DNS RECORD) Go to Route 53 > Hosted zones > sgutodolist.com. Create Record for Root domain: Click Create record. Record name: (leave blank). Type: A. Alias: Yes (Swipe the button to the right). Route traffic to: Alias ​​to CloudFront distribution. Choose distribution: Select the CloudFront domain (e.g. d123...cloudfront.net). Click Create records.

item.title: Deploy and Test
item.description: PHASE 6: DEPLOY & TESTING Step 6.1: Build & Deploy On your local computer (in the React project folder): # 1. Build to the production folder npm run build # 2. Upload to the MAIN bucket (Singapore) # Note: Just upload to Sing, AWS will automatically copy to US aws s3 sync build/ s3://sgutodolist-frontend-sg --delete # 3. Clear the CloudFront cache so users can see the new code immediately aws cloudfront create-invalidation --distribution-id <ID_CUA_BAN> --paths "/*" Step 6.2: Test Go to https://sgutodolist.com.
